alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Weston County Plains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 30 at 3:20AM MDT until August 30 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, AND 317... .Critical fire weather conditions are expected to develop this afternoon. South to southwest winds will continue to increase this morning ahead of a cold front. Winds will shift to the west- northwest late this morning and afternoon behind a surface trough and then a passing cool front. Gusts to 35 mph are expected, especially across southern Campbell and Weston counties. Relative humidities will be very low this afternoon, dropping to near or below 10 percent in many areas. The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidities will result in critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, AND 317... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell and 317 Weston County Plains. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Weston County Plains
